channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Three potholes in pavement outside my property. One c. 40mm deep and 1000mm x 500mm in size . One c. 20mm deep and 500mm x 300mm in size. One small one same depth and c 300mm x 200mm in size. Uneven surface making it dangerous for pedestrians and getting worse as it is driven over by my vehicles., 23rd March
item.description:
The damaged pavement areas are outside 285 Prestbury Road gL52 3DB. What3words approximate references are: formal mute offer and gent hulk proper.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 285, Prestbury Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There are too many potholes to count. They need urgent proper repair., 23rd March
item.description:
A few weeks ago someone was sent out to mend holes. They inadequately filled two holes and left the rest. It's a nonsense and is very dangerous. There are large rocks from the under road surface all across the road. There are pot holes on top of other potholes. It's is not cost effective to just filo and refill the same holes. It needs resurfacing. The area stretches from the junction approximately 10m up. It is dangerous especially in the dark. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Athelney Way, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 12-14 inch pothole extending from existing patched up hole on Hales Road near the junction of Eldon Road. Right next to the bus stop, 23rd March
item.description:
On Hales Road between 122 and 125 heading northbound (towards Hewlett Road and Priors Road). It is right next to the bus stop. It has been growing for months now.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 125, Hales Road, Battledown, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several potholes in a 5 m stretch of road on near side heading to Pilley Bridge., 23rd March
item.description:
Outside 1 Greenhills Road. One small pothole was fixed on 22 March and I was informed that “pothole was repaired”. Just look at the state of the tarmac today. Also check how many times it has been repaired since Jan 2024. The thump of every tyre going through this section tells any person the state of this section of tarmac. Impossible to cycle through it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Greenhills Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road humps poorly installed along entire stretch, 23rd March
item.description:
The new sleeping policemen / road calming measures recently installed on this entire stretch between the c3 church and post office are all too close to the central white lines. Vehicles travelling over them are required to move towards the central white line in order to straddle them - which vehicles coming the other way are also doing - meaning they are forced to pass too close to each other at the centre of the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous potholes in road and uneven pavement, 22nd March
item.description:
Pavement worst at Griffiths Avenue end of Chad Road. We struggle to push a wheelchair along this pavement every Sunday taking resident(s) from the Granleys Care Home to St Marks Church. This problem and the potholes have been like this for years.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4a;4b, Chad Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
